camera_to_lcd.c

00012 //POB-Eye include
00013 #include <pob-eye.h> 
00014 
00015 
00016 int main (void)
00017 {
00018 
00019         //LCD buffer, 128*64 pixels, 1 byte per pixel
00020         UInt8 LCD_Buffer [64*64*BYTES];
00021         
00022         // Graphic buffer
00023         GraphicBuffer LCD_Screen; 
00024         
00025         // Frame of camera
00026         UInt8 * FrameFromCam;
00027 
00028         //Initialize POB-Eye and LCD screen
00029         InitPobeye2();
00030         InitI2C(I2C_100_KHZ);
00031         InitCameraPobeye2();
00032         InitLCD();
00033 
00034 
00035         // Init the graphic buffer : 64 per 64, 1 bytes per pixel and LCD_Buffer
00036         InitGraphicBuffer(&LCD_Screen,64,64,EIGHT_BITS,LCD_Buffer);
00037 
00038         // Clear the graphic buffer
00039         ClearGraphicBuffer(&LCD_Screen);
00040         
00041         // Get the pointer of the red,green and blue video buffer
00042         FrameFromCam = GetRGBFrame();
00043 
00044         while (1)
00045         {
00046                 // Grab the RGB components
00047                 GrabRGBFrame();
00048                 
00049                 // Binary the RGB buffer
00050                 BinaryRGBFrame(FrameFromCam);
00051 
00052                 // Put the pixel from the red component witch is binary, to the lcd buffer
00053                 DrawComponentInABufferVideo(FrameFromCam,&LCD_Screen);
00054 
00055                 // Draw Left LCD with the camera frame
00056                 DrawLeftLCD(&LCD_Screen);
00057         }
00058 
00059         return 0;
00060 }
